base_layer_config.node_url.description: Initial ethereum node URL. A schema to match to Infura node: https://mainnet.infura.io/v3/<your_api_key>, but any other node can be used. May be be replaced during runtime if becomes inoperative

base_layer_config.prague_blob_gas_calc.description: If true use the blob gas calculcation from the Pectra upgrade. If false use the EIP 4844 calculation.

base_layer_config.timeout_millis.description: The timeout (milliseconds) for a query of the L1 base layer

batcher_config.block_builder_config.boun.description: An upper bound on the total l1_gas used in a block.
An upper bound on the message segment length in a block.
An upper bound on the total number of events generated in a block.
An upper bound on the total number of transactions in a block.
An upper bound on the total builtins and steps gas usage used in a block.
An upper bound on the total sierra_gas used in a block.
An upper bound on the total state diff size in a block.

batcher_config.block_builder_config.chai.description: The chain ID of the StarkNet chain.
Address of the ETH fee token.
Address of the STRK fee token.

batcher_config.block_builder_config.exec.description: Number of parallel transaction execution workers.
The thread stack size (proportional to the maximal gas of a transaction).

batcher_config.block_builder_config.n_co.description: Number of transactions in each request from the tx_provider.

batcher_config.block_builder_config.tx_p.description: Time to wait (in milliseconds) between transaction requests when the previous request returned no transactions.

batcher_config.block_builder_config.vers.description: Maximum number of steps the invoke function is allowed to run.
Maximum number of events that can be emitted from the transation.
Maximum recursion depth for nested calls during blockifier validation.
Maximum number of steps the validation function is allowed to run.

batcher_config.contract_class_manager_co.description: The size of the compilation request channel.
Contracts for Cairo Specifies whether to execute all class hashes or only a limited selection using Cairo native contracts. If limited, a specific list of class hashes is provided. compilation.
Whether to panic on compilation failure.
Block Sequencer main program while compiling sierra, for testing.
The size of the global contract cache.
The path to the Sierra-to-Native compiler binary.
Limitation of compiled Cairo Native file size (bytes).
Limitation of compilation process's virtual memory (bytes).
The level of optimization to apply during compilation.

batcher_config.input_stream_content_buff.description: Sets the buffer size for the input transaction channel. Adding more transactions beyond this limit will block until space is available.

batcher_config.max_l1_handler_txs_per_bl.description: The maximum number of L1 handler transactions to include in a block proposal.

batcher_config.outstream_content_buffer_.description: The maximum number of items to include in a single get_proposal_content response.

batcher_config.pre_confirmed_block_write.description: The capacity of the channel buffer for receiving pre-confirmed transactions.
Time interval (ms) between writing pre-confirmed blocks. Writes occur only when block data changes.

batcher_config.pre_confirmed_cende_confi.description: The URL of the Pythonic cende_recorder

batcher_config.storage.db_config.chain_i.description: The chain to follow. For more details see https://docs.starknet.io/documentation/architecture_and_concepts/Blocks/transactions/#chain-id.

batcher_config.storage.db_config.enforce.description: Whether to enforce that the path exists. If true, `open_env` fails when the mdbx.dat file does not exist.

batcher_config.storage.db_config.growth_.description: The growth step in bytes, must be greater than zero to allow the database to grow.

batcher_config.storage.db_config.max_siz.description: The maximum size of the node's storage in bytes.

batcher_config.storage.db_config.min_siz.description: The minimum size of the node's storage in bytes.

batcher_config.storage.db_config.path_pr.description: Prefix of the path of the node's storage directory, the storage file path will be <path_prefix>/<chain_id>. The path is not created automatically.

batcher_config.storage.mmap_file_config..description: The growth step in bytes, must be greater than max_object_size.
The maximum size of a single object in the file in bytes
The maximum size of a memory mapped file in bytes. Must be greater than growth_step.

batcher_config.storage.scope.description: The categories of data saved in storage.

chain_id.description: The chain to follow. For more details see https://docs.starknet.io/documentation/architecture_and_concepts/Blocks/transactions/#chain-id.

class_manager_config.class_manager_confi.description: Limitation of compiled contract class object size.

class_manager_config.class_storage_confi.description: Whether to enforce that the path exists. If true, `open_env` fails when the mdbx.dat file does not exist.

The maximum size of a single object in the file in bytes
The maximum size of a memory mapped file in bytes. Must be greater than growth_step.
The categories of data saved in storage.
Path to the node's class storage directory.

compiler_config.max_bytecode_size.description: Limitation of compiled CASM bytecode size (felts).

compiler_config.max_memory_usage.description: Limitation of compilation process's virtual memory (bytes).

consensus_manager_config.assume_no_malic.description: Assumes all validators are honest. If true, uses 1/2 votes to get quorum. Use with caution!

consensus_manager_config.broadcast_buffe.description: The buffer size for the broadcast channel.

consensus_manager_config.cende_config.re.description: The URL of the Pythonic cende_recorder

consensus_manager_config.cende_config.sk.description: A height that the consensus can skip writing to Aerospike. Needed for booting up (no previous height blob to write) or to handle extreme cases (all the nodes failed).

consensus_manager_config.consensus_confi.description: How many heights in the future should we cache.
How many rounds should we cache for future heights.
How many rounds in the future (for current height) should we cache.
Delay (seconds) before starting consensus to give time for network peering.
The validator id of the node.

consensus_manager_config.context_config..description: Maximum allowed deviation (seconds) of a proposed block's timestamp from the current time.
Safety margin (in ms) to make sure that the batcher completes building the proposal with enough time for the Fin to be checked by validators.
The address of the contract that builds the block.
The chain id of the Starknet chain.
The data availability mode, true: Blob, false: Calldata.
Part per thousand of multiplicative factor to apply to the data gas price, to enable fine-tuning of the price charged to end users.
This additional gas is added to the L1 gas price.
The maximum L1 data gas price in wei.
The maximum L1 gas price in wei.
The minimum L1 data gas price in wei.
The minimum L1 gas price in wei.
The buffer size for streaming outbound proposals.
Safety margin (in ms) to make sure that consensus determines when to timeout validating a proposal.

consensus_manager_config.eth_to_strk_ora.description: URL to query. The `timestamp` parameter is appended dynamically when making requests, in order to have a stable mapping from block timestamp to conversion rate.
HTTP headers for the eth to strk oracle, formatted as 'k1:v1 k2:v2 ...'.

The size of the interval (seconds) that the eth to strk rate is taken on. The lag refers to the fact that the interval `[T, T+k)` contains the conversion rate for queries in the interval `[T+k, T+2k)`. Should be configured in alignment with relevant query parameters in `base_url`, if required.
The maximum number of cached conversion rates.
The timeout (seconds) for the query to the eth to strk oracle.

consensus_manager_config.immediate_activ.description: The height at which the node may actively participate in consensus.

consensus_manager_config.network_config..description: The external address other peers see this node. If this is set, the node will not try to find out which addresses it has and will write this address as external instead
The multiaddress of the peer node. It should include the peer's id. For more info: https://docs.libp2p.io/concepts/fundamentals/peers/
The size of the buffer that holds the metadata of the broadcasted messages.
The chain to follow. For more details see https://docs.starknet.io/documentation/architecture_and_concepts/Blocks/transactions/#chain-id.
The base delay in milliseconds for the exponential backoff strategy.
The factor for the exponential backoff strategy.
The maximum delay in seconds for the exponential backoff strategy.
The interval between each discovery (Kademlia) query in milliseconds.
Amount of time in seconds that a connection with no active sessions will stay alive.
The duration in seconds a peer is blacklisted after being marked as malicious.
The duration in milliseconds a peer blacklisted after being reported as unstable.
The port that the node listens on for incoming tcp connections.
The size of the buffer that holds the reported peer ids.
The secret key used for building the peer id. If it's an empty string a random one will be used.
Maximal time in seconds that each session can take before failing on timeout.

consensus_manager_config.revert_config.r.description: The component will revert blocks up to this block number (including).

consensus_manager_config.revert_config.s.description: If set true, the component would revert blocks and do nothing else.

consensus_manager_config.stream_handler_.description: The capacity of the channel buffer for stream messages.
The maximum number of streams that can be open at the same time.

eth_fee_token_address.description: Address of the ETH fee token.

gateway_config.block_declare.description: If true, the gateway will block declare transactions.

gateway_config.chain_info.chain_id.description: The chain ID of the StarkNet chain.

gateway_config.chain_info.fee_token_addr.description: Address of the ETH fee token.
Address of the STRK fee token.

gateway_config.stateful_tx_validator_con.description: The maximum allowed gap between the account nonce and the transaction nonce.
Maximum nonce for which the validation is skipped.
If true, rejects declare transactions with future nonces.
Maximum number of steps the invoke function is allowed to run.
Maximum number of events that can be emitted from the transation.
Maximum recursion depth for nested calls during blockifier validation.
Maximum number of steps the validation function is allowed to run.

gateway_config.stateless_tx_validator_co.description: Limitation of contract class bytecode size.
Limitation of contract class object size.

The minor version of the configuration.
The patch version of the configuration.
The major version of the configuration.
The minor version of the configuration.
The patch version of the configuration.
If true, validates that at least one resource bound (L1, L2, or L1 Data) is non-zero.

l1_endpoint_monitor_config.ordered_l1_en.description: Ordered list of L1 endpoint URLs, used in order, cyclically, switching if the current one is non-operational.

l1_gas_price_provider_config.lag_margin_.description: Difference between the time of the block from L1 used to calculate the gas price and the time of the L2 block this price is used in

l1_gas_price_provider_config.max_time_ga.description: Maximum valid time gap between the requested timestamp and the last price sample in seconds

l1_gas_price_provider_config.number_of_b.description: Number of blocks to use for the mean gas price calculation

l1_gas_price_provider_config.storage_lim.description: Maximum number of L1 blocks to keep cached

l1_gas_price_scraper_config.chain_id.description: The chain to follow. For more details see https://docs.starknet.io/documentation/architecture_and_concepts/Blocks/transactions/#chain-id

l1_gas_price_scraper_config.finality.description: Number of blocks to wait for finality in L1

l1_gas_price_scraper_config.number_of_bl.description: Number of blocks to use for the mean gas price calculation

l1_gas_price_scraper_config.polling_inte.description: The duration (seconds) between each scraping attempt of L1

l1_gas_price_scraper_config.startup_num_.description: How many sets of config.num_blocks_for_mean blocks to go back on the chain when starting to scrape.

l1_provider_config.bootstrap_catch_up_he.description: Override height at which the provider should catch up to the bootstrapper.

l1_provider_config.l1_handler_cancellati.description: How long to allow a transaction requested for cancellation to be validated against (proposals are banned upon receiving a cancellation request).

l1_provider_config.new_l1_handler_cooldo.description: How long to wait before allowing new L1 handler transactions to be proposed (validation is available immediately).

l1_provider_config.provider_startup_heig.description: Override height at which the provider should start

l1_provider_config.startup_sync_sleep_re.description: Interval in seconds between each retry of syncing with L2 during startup.

l1_scraper_config.chain_id.description: The chain to follow. For more details see https://docs.starknet.io/documentation/architecture_and_concepts/Blocks/transactions/#chain-id.

l1_scraper_config.finality.description: Number of blocks to wait for finality

l1_scraper_config.polling_interval_secon.description: Interval in Seconds between each scraping attempt of L1.

l1_scraper_config.startup_rewind_time_se.description: Duration in seconds to rewind from latest L1 block when starting scraping.

mempool_config.capacity_in_bytes.description: Maximum size of the mempool, in bytes.

mempool_config.committed_nonce_retention.description: Number of latest committed blocks for which committed account nonces are retained.

mempool_config.declare_delay.description: Time to wait before allowing a Declare transaction to be returned, in seconds.

mempool_config.enable_fee_escalation.description: If true, transactions can be replaced with higher fee transactions.

mempool_config.fee_escalation_percentage.description: Percentage increase for tip and max gas price to enable transaction replacement.

mempool_config.override_gas_price_thresh.description: If true, transactions with max L2 gas price per unit bound that are less than the threshold are still inserted into the priority queue.

mempool_config.transaction_ttl.description: Time-to-live for transactions in the mempool, in seconds.

mempool_p2p_config.max_transaction_batch.description: Maximum number of transactions in each batch.

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.advert.description: The external address other peers see this node. If this is set, the node will not try to find out which addresses it has and will write this address as external instead

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.bootst.description: The multiaddress of the peer node. It should include the peer's id. For more info: https://docs.libp2p.io/concepts/fundamentals/peers/

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.broadc.description: The size of the buffer that holds the metadata of the broadcasted messages.

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.chain_.description: The chain to follow. For more details see https://docs.starknet.io/documentation/architecture_and_concepts/Blocks/transactions/#chain-id.

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.report.description: The size of the buffer that holds the reported peer ids.

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.secret.description: The secret key used for building the peer id. If it's an empty string a random one will be used.

mempool_p2p_config.network_config.sessio.description: Maximal time in seconds that each session can take before failing on timeout.

mempool_p2p_config.transaction_batch_rat.description: Maximum time until a transaction batch is closed and propagated in milliseconds.
